description: From Middle English rekles, reckeles, rekkeles, (also recheles), from Old English rēcelēas (“reckless, careless, negligent”), equivalent to reck +‎ -less. Cognate with West Frisian roekeleas (“reckless”), Dutch roekeloos (“reckless”), German Low German ruuklos (“careless”), German ruchlos (“careless, notorious”).

adjectives.description: reckless (comparative recklesser or more reckless, superlative recklessest or most reckless)

entries.meaning: Careless or heedless; headstrong or rash.
Indifferent or oblivious to danger or the consequences thereof.
